entry.summary: ...AREAS OF SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW TO CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 7:02AM AKDT until March 17 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph reducing visibility to one half mile at times in blowing snow.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 7:02AM AKDT until March 17 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY FOR THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN COPPER RIVER BASIN... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of one to three inches with locally higher amounts along the Richardson Highway south of the Edgerton Highway Junction. * WHERE...Copper River Basin south and west of Glennallen.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 7:02AM AKDT until March 17 at 8:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches along the coast, with higher accumulations of up to 10 inches further inland. Northwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Mobile County through 230 PM CDT... entry.summary: Strong northwest winds gusting 40 to 50 mph expected late this morning into the afternoon across east-central Wyoming and portions of the Nebraska Panhandle. Use caution if traveling. Strong wind gusts could be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers.
